Description: Dark yellowish-green blown glass jug with a rounded outsplayed rim with a strengthening trail below, a cylindrical neck, a cylindrical body, a seven-ribbed handle and a slightly concave base. Decorated with with six bands of various cut and abraded designs separated by horizontal circles.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (112)
Harden et al 1968 / Masterpieces of Glass (105)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
Purchased through: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
